definition: (ball sports) good shot!/nice hit!/well played!
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
ball/sphere/globe/CL:個|个[ge4]/ball game/match/CL:場|场[chang3]

sentences.english: If no. 6 had set up better, Louis would have made a terrific spike.
sentences.chinese: 如果6号队员的二传更好些，路易斯就会扣个好球。

sentences.english: And Yi did a great job off the bench, after missing 24 games.
sentences.chinese: 在缺席24场比赛后，阿联打出了一场好球。

sentences.english: Most have been bred from one, or just a few, wild-caught individuals.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的好球是一只或几只野生球蟒生育而来的。

sentences.english: He played a good-length ball back to the bowler.
sentences.chinese: 他传给投手一个落点好球。

sentences.english: I'm feeling good here, so I think I've got a good shot.
sentences.chinese: 我在这感觉很好，所以我想我会打出好球。

sentences.english: The pitcher threw a high inside pitch to brush the batter back.
sentences.chinese: 这投手一个高内角球，使击球手紧张而打不出好球。

sentences.english: Let's work on it, next we play against a good side in Liverpool.
sentences.chinese: 让我们在对阵利物浦的时候打一场好球吧。

sentences.english: I just wanted to play well for myself.
sentences.chinese: 我只是想为自己打场好球。

sentences.english: As you would expect. For the best players, the head is as good as their feet.
sentences.chinese: 正如你所料，最好的球员用头同样可以“踢”的好球。

sentences.english: The Ukrainian then sent in a cross-shot which Gilardino headed over.
sentences.chinese: 乌克兰人接着又为队友传出好球，吉拉迪诺头球顶高。

sentences.english: I could have just really got it rolling.
sentences.chinese: 我原本可以打场好球的。

sentences.english: Nate: And a good ballplayer, if i remember right.
sentences.chinese: 如果我没记错的话，他还是个好球。

sentences.english: Besides, I wasn't known for my strike-zone discipline;
sentences.chinese: 除此之外，我并不能算是个慎选好球的打者。

sentences.english: He decides whether the pitcher has thrown a ball or strike.
sentences.chinese: 他判定投手是否投了一个好球以及算不算一击。

sentences.english: call balls and strikes behind the plate.
sentences.chinese: 在本垒板后判为好球或坏球。

definition: ball/sphere/globe/CL:個|个[ge4]/ball game/match/CL:場|场[chang3]
pass (in soccer)/to feed (ball)
middle period of a tripartite provincial exam (in former times)/midfield/mid-court (in sports)/half-time/intermission half-way through a performance
sports club member/footballer, golfer etc
to score a goal/goal (sport)
to replace (a damaged component with a new one, an injured player with a substitute player, full-time workers with casual workers etc)/a substitute/a replacement
(ball sports) dead ball
half of a game or contest/half-court
to defend/to protect (against)
competition (sports etc)/match/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]/to compete
to equalize/to level the score/to pull back the advantage
to serve the ball/to tee off
sports team (basketball, soccer, football etc)
to receive a served ball (volleyball, tennis etc)/to catch a ball thrown by sb
to set up a teammate (with an opportunity to score)/to throw a game
on stage/to go on stage/to take the field
